alert.note: Alert for Cattaraugus (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 9:32PM EST until January 30 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New York... Allegheny River At Olean affecting Cattaraugus County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New York... Tonawanda Creek At Rapids affecting Erie and Niagara Counties. For the Allegheny River...including Olean, Salamanca...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Tonawanda Creek...including Attica, Batavia, Rapids...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Allegheny River at Olean. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flood stage, flooding possible on Union Street in Allegany and East Riverside Drive 1 to 3 miles upstream of Olean. Some farm lands along the river are also impacted. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM EST Sunday the stage was 12.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 12.2 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.3 feet on 03/11/2009. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 945 AM EST.
